title: Understanding Least Restrictive Environment
text: A least restrictive environment is a setting that allows individuals to receive treatment with minimal limitations on their daily life. It aims to provide the necessary support while maintaining as much independence as possible.

title: Key Characteristics of Least Restrictive Environment
text: Consider the balance between effective treatment and the level of freedom or independence the client retains. The goal is to ensure the client can live as freely as possible while still receiving the necessary care.

hintAnswer: one in which the client receives the most effective treatment that places the fewest restrictions on their life
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes a least restrictive environment?
choices: one in which the client receives the most effective treatment that places the fewest restrictions on their life

offer intensive case management services that allow a person to live in their own home with the support of trained personnel who assist them with transportation to $$health-care$$ provider appointments, running errands, peer support services, and care coordination
more convenient, less expensive, encourage $$longer-term$$ $$\frac{client}{counselor}$$ relationships, keep the client working, and are more amenable to family support
